means: 阉牛，一岁半以下的小公牛
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 布洛克绰号，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“小公牛”(bullock)

sentence.Network_en: He was sweating like a bullock.
And Governor Bullock never sets foot in this house again.
sentence.Network_cn: 还有,无论如何不要再让布洛克州长进我家的家门了.

sentence.Network_en: A bullock is a castrated bull.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English  bulluc, diminutive of bula (see bull). The verb (late 19th cent.) is by association with a bullock's use as a draught animal

entry.def: A bullock is a young bull that has been castrated.
